title: Aural set, Gloria - first two sung chords

content.question: The harmonic progression of the first two sung chords (on the word "Gloria") is

choices.label: The figure shows chord progressions. The progressions are Major V in first inversion and Major One.
The figure shows chord progression. The progressions are Major V dominant in third inversion, Major one in first inversion.
The figure shows chord progressions. The progressions are Major V dominant in root position and Major one.
The figure shows chord progressions. The progressions are Major five dominant in first inversion and Major one.

content.answer: The figure shows chord progression. The progressions are Major V dominant in third inversion, Major one in first inversion.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Use symbols and terms to describe melodic, harmonic, and rhythmic relationships in performed music. (This skill is applied in describing these elements in a full musical context.)
